0: As a hotel apartment it is good as you have cooking and laundry facilities
The apartment style rooms to acomodate a small familyits location to facilities trains etc
Great location great facilities quiet and comfy
Great range of tea coffees etc in kitchen and toiletries in bathroom and beds comfortable
Overall I think the accommodation is great staff are courteous helpful and friendly
The reception area is nice enough and friendly staff
Big rooms and good gym and pool
great location close to all amenities and to the city
Comfy bed and pillows bathroom plumbing needs some work as does tv reception for free to view channels
1: The amenities at the Mantra was of a high standard
It has a well functioning laundry place a basic kitchen and gym
Good BUT the lifts in this hotel are very problematic
If I am looking for hotel I pass by and see messy lobby I wo n’t go in
2: Negatives Hotel needs an urgent refurbishment particularly the carpets in the foyer hallways and rooms

When I got back to the room after an evening out there were no tea bags in the room neither TV remote worked in the room and then only one elevator worked which the workers took over so it kept skipping the ground floor so I waited for 10 minutes to get back to the car park
The hallway on level 2 was incredibly uneven
From the lobby to lift and room
but the tragedy what I was really looking forward to was the spa in the gym
The facilities are getting a bit dated

THis must be the only hotel accommodation I have stayed that does not have a parking space for checking in only spot out front was loading zone and in the 4 minutes it took to check in I was booked 191 seriously angry
No issues pleasant people at reception
A long mirror in the bedroom rather than the hallway would seem more appropriate
The gym equipment needs some maintenance to it as some of it is dangerous in the state it is currently in
